chapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure
evidences.name: University Collar Pin
evidences.description1: Proof that I'm a student at the Imperial Yumei University. I always wear it on the collar of my uniform jacket.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure
evidences.name: Post-Mortem Report
evidences.description1: Death occurred a little after 2 p.m. and was caused by loss of blood from a gunshot to the chest. The bullet did not pass through the victim's body.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure
evidences.name: Photograph of Victim
evidences.description1: A photographic print that shows the victim. He was shot from the front in the chest and subsequently died.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure
evidences.name: Waiter's Business Card
evidences.description1: The head waiter's business card. A sketch of the restaurant's layout is on the back.
evidences.description2: A sketch of the restaurant's layout is on the back. On the front, it's stated that Hosonaga-san is a police inspector.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph
evidences.description1: A bottle of carbonated water and a steak lunch can be seen on the victim's table.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure
evidences.name: Medical Report Card
evidences.description1: A medical report card from Hotta Clinic that was found in the victim's pocket.
evidences.description2: A record of dental work. On the day of the murder, the victim had undergone dental treatment and been prohibited from eating or drinking anything but water.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure
evidences.name: Photograph of Handbag
evidences.description1: A photograph taken by Hosonaga-san after the incident occurred. It shows Miss Brett's handbag on a chair by the victim's table.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure
evidences.name: Carbonated Water Bottle
evidences.description1: The carbonated water the victim and Miss Brett shared on the day of the murder. It was on the victim's table.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure
evidences.name: Jezaille's Report
evidences.description1: A report detailing an unknown poison that Miss Brett has been researching during her time at Yumei University.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Great Departure
evidences.name: Plate of Steak
evidences.description1: The meal Miss Brett ordered for lunch. It was removed from the victim's table after the incident.

chapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: University Collar Pin
evidences.description1: Proof that I'm a student at the Imperial Yumei University. I always wear it on the collar of my uniform jacket.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Paper Seal
evidences.description1: Kazuma would stick this over the doors of the wardrobe for me. It says 'Keep out' in Japanese, though I'm not sure the Russian crew can actually read it.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph
evidences.description1: The Russian word for 'wardrobe' in purple ink. It would appear to have been written in the victim's final moments.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Article About Revolutionary
evidences.description1: An article on the front page of a Russian newspaper. The headline reads: 'Revolutionary Vilen Borshevik Flees Russia via Shanghai'.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Article About Ballerina
evidences.description1: An article on the back page of a Russian newspaper. The headline reads: 'Renowned Prima Ballerina of the Novavich Ballet Disappears from Shanghai!'

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Kazuma's Diary
evidences.description1: A diary Kazuma was keeping of his trip to London. According to the last entry he made before his death, he spied what appeared to be a 'speckled band'.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Post-Mortem Report
evidences.description1: A report from the SS Burya's medical officer, giving the cause of death as a cervical spine injury. There were no traces of external injury or poison.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Mark on Floor
evidences.description1: A piece of a small glass object and what looks like a scuff mark made by Kazuma's shoes were found by the victim's body.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Ship's Log
evidences.description1: A record kept by the crew assigned to the first-class cabin area. There are virtually no entries from 2 a.m. until early this morning.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Pavlova & Darka Photograph
evidences.description1: A photograph of Miss Pavlova and her 'friend' - a kitten named Darka. The tiara she would wear on stage can also be seen.

chapter: The Adventure of the Runaway Room

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Runaway Room
evidences.name: Armband
evidences.description1: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Runaway Room
evidences.name: Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: A report prepared by the Scotland Yard coroner. It gives the cause of death as internal haemorrhaging as a result of a single stab wound to the abdomen.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Runaway Room
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph
evidences.description1: A photograph of the victim taken on the omnibus. The knife in his abdomen is clearly visible, but his face is partly obscured from view by an old, crooked hat.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Runaway Room
evidences.name: Defendant's Leather Gloves
evidences.description1: The leather gloves the defendant was wearing at the time of the incident. There is a bloodstain on the right glove.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Runaway Room
evidences.name: Omnibus
evidences.description1: The eight-seater omnibus that was the scene of the crime. There were passengers both inside the carriage and on the roof deck that night.
evidences.description2: The scene of the crime. There is a bloodstain visible on the frame of the skylight when it's open.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Runaway Room
evidences.name: Murder Weapon
evidences.description1: A largish knife that was found lodged in the victim's abdomen. Its quality and fancy ornamentation suggest it must be quite valuable.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Runaway Room
evidences.name: Debtors' Ledger
evidences.description1: A catalogue of people who had borrowed money from the defendant at a high rate of interest. It includes the victim, who owed twenty guineas.
evidences.description2: Among the defendant's list of debtors is Bruce Fairplay, who would have been due to repay his loan imminently.

chapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Armband
evidences.description1: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Local Map
evidences.description1: A street map of the local area showing where the victim was found.
evidences.description2: A street map of the local area showing locations that are relevant to the case.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Iris's Postcard
evidences.description1: A card for Inspector Gregson with a message on the back from Iris.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Secondhand Book Receipt
evidences.description1: A receipt discovered in Mr Natsume's room for some books that he had purchased from a secondhand bookshop before the incident occurred.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Case File
evidences.description1: A file containing an overview of the case and details about the victim. She was found with a knife in her back and is currently in hospital, yet to regain consciousness.
evidences.description2: The pavement where the victim was found lies just outside Constable Beate's beat, the border of which runs down the middle of Briar Road.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Jackknife
evidences.description1: A large but commonplace folding knife. It was found lodged in the victim's back.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph
evidences.description1: A photograph of the scene taken by a policeman just after the incident occurred. A large knife can be seen thrust into the victim's back.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph #2
evidences.description1: A second photograph of the scene taken by a policeman just after the incident. It specifically shows the victim's hand.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: The Fourth Book
evidences.description1: A book entitled 'The Lion's Pride' discovered in the victim's hand at the scene.
evidences.description2: A book entitled 'The Lion's Pride' discovered in the victim's hand at the scene. The back cover is badly burnt. * (This update to the description is entirely optional, and can only be achieved by examining the burnt corner on the back before it is specifically pointed out in court.)
evidences.description3: A book entitled 'The Lion's Pride' that was in the victim's hand when Mrs Beate first ran over to see what had happened.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Warrant Card
evidences.description1: A small folding wallet that identifies London bobbies and contains the rules of conduct to which they must adhere.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Anniversary Bouquet
evidences.description1: A present for Patricia Beate from her husband, Roly. The shock of seeing the stabbed victim caused Mrs Beate to drop the rose where she stood.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Pipe
evidences.description1: Mr Garrideb's pipe. Apparently it fell to the floor during a domestic dispute he had with his wife and broke.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Fragment of Metal
evidences.description1: This small piece of metal looks like it might be the tip of a knife blade. It was stuck inside the bowl of Mr Garrideb's pipe.

chapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Armband
evidences.description1: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Music Box Disk
evidences.description1: A metal disk used to play music in a mechanical music box. The piece of music, which remains unidentified, is stored on the disk by means of small protrusions.
evidences.description2: A metal disk used to play music in a mechanical music box. On the reverse side is a note that reads, 'For McGilded'.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: White Cat Photograph → Pawnbroker's Ticket (Box)
evidences.description1: A photograph depicting a sweet little white cat, obtained from Gina while interviewing her in her prison cell.
evidences.description2: A redemption ticket issued from the pawnbrokery owned by the victim, Mr Windibank, in the form of some hand-written notes on the back of a photograph.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Gina's Representation Papers
evidences.description1: The paperwork signed by Gina to put me in charge of her defence. Showing this to Scotland Yard detectives gains us access to the crime scene.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: White Cat Photograph #2 → Pawnbroker's Ticket (Coat)
evidences.description1: A photograph depicting a sweet little white cat. I feel as though I have another print just like this one...
evidences.description2: A redemption ticket issued from the pawnbrokery owned by the victim, Mr Windibank. There's what looks like a bloody fingermark on it.
evidences.description3: A redemption ticket issued from the pawnbrokery owned by the victim, Mr Windibank. The blood on it has been identified as Mr Mason's.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Blood Samples Portfolio
evidences.description1: A sample of blood analysed with a special chemical indicator developed by Mr Sholmes. Different people's blood turns different colours.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Iris's Story Manuscript
evidences.description1: A long, unpublished story that Mr Sholmes deposited at the pawnbrokery of the victim, Mr Windibank. It's entitled 'The Hound of the Baskervilles'.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: McGilded Case Notes
evidences.description1: Notes collated by Miss Susato about the McGilded case that we worked on two months ago.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Today's Paper
evidences.description1: This morning's paper, purchased by Iris. Gina's case features prominently.
evidences.description2: This morning's paper, which contains an article about government secrets being leaked to foreign agencies.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: A report prepared by the Scotland Yard coroner that confirms instant death due to a single bullet wound from the back. There are no other signs of trauma.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph
evidences.description1: A photograph of the victim found murdered in the storeroom. It shows the single bullet wound in the man's back.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
evidences.description1: A plan of Windibank's pawnbrokery, the scene of the crime. It shows the relative positions of the main shop and the rear storeroom.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Windibank's Gun
evidences.description1: A gun belonging to the victim, Mr Windibank, that Gina was holding when she was found unconscious. There are signs of a single discharge.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Skulkin Brothers' Gun
evidences.description1: A firearm found in the possession of the Skulkin brothers upon their arrest. There are signs that a single round was fired.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Photograph of Gina
evidences.description1: A photograph taken automatically by the Red-Handed Recorder showing the scene a short time before the murder took place.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Post-Shooting Photograph
evidences.description1: A photograph taken automatically by the Red-Handed Recorder showing the scene after the murder had taken place.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Stereoscope
evidences.description1: A fold-up device that allows anybody to enjoy seeing things in three dimensions simply by looking through the eyepieces.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Sholmes's Pouch
evidences.description1: The pouch Mr Sholmes was wearing around his waist at the time of the shooting. One of the glass phials is smashed and there are scorch marks around it.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: The Third Bullet
evidences.description1: A projectile we discovered lodged in Mr Sholmes's pouch. It caused one of the phials to explode, injuring Mr Sholmes.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Small Music Box
evidences.description1: This strange music box only appears to be able to play a single tone. It was deposited at Windibank's two days before the black overcoat.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unspeakable Story
evidences.name: Cat-Flapomat
evidences.description1: A compact machine for the rapid creation of small flaps in larger doors, to allow cats to come and go freely.
